Posts.Title: No surgery today...fluid now leaking from 2 ducts? Chancesmom CrunchyPoodleMama

Posts.Content: May 1, 2010 06:35AM mpwife98 wrote: I agree with Bessie on everything.  Google your town and breast specialist and that will likely help.  That was how I find my BS and then did a little research on him to make sure he was a good one.  I too have FBD and it really does help to do the regular BSE's to learn what is normal for you and what is not.
Posts.Title: Small City, Same Problems-need recommendations negirl mpwife98

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2010 09:14AM mpwife98 wrote: I agree with Beesie.  You're only option isn't to have it removed.  They can do a biopsy on it (there is more than one type) and test it that way but the only way to be 100% sure is to have it removed and tested.  It's up to you really.  When I was 22 I developed my very first lump and it freaked me out and long story short I had it removed and it was B9 and I did regret the decision - still do - but that personal choice there.  I was awake during the procedure with local anethesia only and it was bascially "in office", it wasn't pleasant but I wasn't given the option of having general and I wasn't in the best hands.  I currently have a suspicious lump and I am taking the least invasive route this time around to try and determine what it is.  It's all up to you.  Some women want them out immediately no matter what mamms, ultrasounds or biopsys say and some wait it out and take other routes.  Remember, it's a personal choice that only you can make and make only the one that is most comfortable to you at this point.
Posts.Title: Have it out or leave it alone? amjmom amjmom

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2010 02:59PM mpwife98 wrote: B9 lumps can increase in size.  Since you are worried  about this & it's been there that long, ask them for a biopsy of the lump.  Have they tried a fine needle aspiration or anything? My mammogram was useless to me because of my level of density and I have under the muscle implants so on ultrasound the radiologist & tech couldn't pick up my lump in my right breast (left hasn't been attempted yet - long story) because of my tissue being compressed between the muscle and skin. Perhaps some of the other women can shed some light on why your's wouldn't pick up on ultrasound.
